annotation.spannedText: Chief Complaint: hypercarbic resp failure I saw and examined the patient, and was physically present with the ICU Resident for key portions of the services provided. I agree with his / her note above, including assessment and plan. HPI: 47 yr old woman with obesity and asthma went to [**Hospital1 **] [**Location (un) 1415**] [**2130-7-11**] with dyspnea, new onset SVT, and was Rx'd for SVT with Amio, then Dig, then cardioversion [**2130-7-19**] which was sucessful. In terms of resp distress, at admit ABG was 7.42/ 80/50 - Her resp distress was felt to be cor pulmonale - diuresed 36 pounds. On evening of [**2130-7-19**] - she became somnlent, ? related to meds from cardioversion, or primary CNS event, ABG was 7.27/129/ 80 and started on BIPAP 7.39/102/32 (?vbg), Of note with diuresis, bicarb went to greater than assay. Felt a transfer to [**Hospital1 54**] was on order for possible need for fiberoptic intubation. ABG on leaving was 7.48/77/47 Patient admitted from: Transfer from other hospital History obtained from [**Hospital 85**] Medical records

annotation.spannedText: Assessment and Plan 47 yr old woman with morbid obesity, OSA and obesity hypoventilation, presents to OSH with Afib and ?decompensated systolic heart failure s/p diuresis at OSH complicated by acute resp decoimpensation at [**Hospital1 **] [**Location (un) 1415**] today 1. Hypercarbic and Hypoxemic Resp Failure: etiology likely OSA, hypoventilation, but possible component of reactive airways. Plan- BIPAP 15/5 as trial and wean FIO2- current ABG looks good 7.33. Need to assess chem 7 here as she has a significantly elevated HCo3 in setting of retention and diuresis. Convert Medrol to 40 prednisone, alb/atrovent nebs. Check CXR to assess parenchyma as right greater than left sided wheezes. 2. SVT: converted with cardioversion and sent over on both Amio and Digoxin. Check Dig level, clarify how many days of Amio 400 TID as may be able to taper. 3. Right Arm Pain s/p PICC: check US to rule out clot ICU Care Nutrition: NPO Glycemic Control: Lines / Intubation: 1 PIV Comments: Prophylaxis: DVT: (Systemic anticoagulation: Coumadin Stress ulcer: PPI Communication: her, sister is HCP [**Name (NI) 66**] status: Full code Disposition: ICU Total time spent: 60 minutes Patient is critically ill
